Hello, recently I have switched from Ubuntu to an ubuntu derivative mainly Linux Mint

@rasakos , Macs are just fancy UNIX machines. You can keep the PC hardware you have and install FreeBSD (which is UNIX) or install Ubuntu (which is Linux).
Unix require a lot of configuration before you can use them (for example, you have to build a lot of applications/programs from source). Linux require less configuration and Ubuntu is by far the most popular Linux distro available today. Youâ€™ll find lots of support for any questions/problems you run into on Ubuntu.

the things I use all the time get stored on my 256gb SSD
For things that I need to store and won't access often, they go on my 1TB HDD
I absolutely love mine
yeah definitely invest in an SSD
@Joe-Balsamo that's good to know. thanks so much for your input!
@orangelines Yeah, we all have to decide what compromises weâ€™re willing to live with, but I know that SSD was the single best performance improvement I made to my machine.
@Joe-Balsamo I do video and photo stuff as a hobby but I also like to conveniently access my collections.  But I also want speed, so that setup is definitely something I'm considering.

@orangelines Well, you might still be able to get away with an internal SSD and an external standard. I do a lot of video and photo stuff as a hobby, but donâ€™t need to have it always accessible, so that works for me. But I understand if someone is a pro videographer/photographer and needs their collection. But also consider, a 2TB HD is tiny, the one I have is just a bit larger than a deck of cards, so no big deal throwing it in my bag.

@Joe-Balsamo thanks! it really helps to know your personal setup. That should've been the question I asked instead :) I store a lot of videos and high res photos ..also have adobe applications installed.... so storage is definitely a priority along side speed.

My personal setup on my MacbookPro is a 500gb SSD with a 2TB external standard hd. I donâ€™t have any issues. I mean, if you are storing tons and tons of video, maybe, but for development? Itâ€™s a non-issue. And SSDâ€™s are FAST!
A 500gb SSD  is $150 or so. Depends on how much storage you need and your budget. :)
@b1ggb3n86 yeah! they're quite expensive considering I want at least 750gb - 1tb. Thanks for your input :)
@orangelines I would totally go for a hybrid, the speed and storage are so good for the price. SSDs are pretty expensive for small amount of storage.

@AVanVlack cool, thanks! An ssd isn't in my budget at the moment so that's why I'm looking at hybrids because I need the space as well as the speed. but if the price different isn't drastic perhaps I'll just get an ssd. I'll look into more
Save the spinning drives for external bulk data or a nas.
They are faster and if you need space and speed in a single drive they will do but full ssd is really the best option.
Any opinions on hybrid hard drives?  (ssd + hdd) I've heard mixed opinions and would like to know what you guys think!
